data.mean: 音乐；乐曲创作（或演奏）艺术

sentence.cn: 在学校标准课程的音乐课上，他悠闲地弹着钢琴，发现挑选乐曲很容易。
sentence.en: In the music class that was part of his school's standard curriculum, he was playing idly on the piano and found it easy to pick out tunes.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

jx.jx_en_mean: something that is very pleasant or gratifying to hear or discover
jx.jx_cn_mean: 悦耳的声音，佳音；中听的话

lj.lj_ly: the commission's report was music to the ears of the government.
lj.lj_ls: 委员会的报告很合政府的心意。

entry.def: Music is the pattern of sounds produced by people singing or playing instruments.

example.tran: 乔治·格什温的音乐作品

entry.def: Music is the art of creating or performing music.

example.ex: He went on to study music, specialising in the clarinet.
example.tran: 他继续学习音乐，主攻单簧管。

entry.def: Music is the symbols written on paper which represent musical sounds.

example.ex: He's never been able to read music.

entry.def: If something that you hear is music to your ears, it makes you feel very happy.
entry.tran: 悦耳的声音;佳音;中听的话

example.ex: Popular support—it's music to the ears of any politician.
example.tran: 大众的支持对任何一名政界人士来说都是佳音。

entry.def: If you face the music, you put yourself in a position where you will be criticized or punished for something you have done.
entry.tran: 承担自己行为的后果;接受批评（或惩罚）

example.ex: Sooner or later, I'm going to have to face the music.
example.tran: 迟早我得自己承担后果。

means.word_mean: 1. an artistic form of auditory communication incorporating instrumental or vocal tones in a structured and continuous manner

sentences.sentence: "he fell asleep to the music of the wind chimes"

means.word_mean: 4. (music) the sounds produced by singers or musical instruments (or reproductions of such sounds)

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French musique, via Latin from Greek mousikē (tekhnē) ('art) of the Muses', from mousa 'muse'

sentences.cn: 1967年，他被封为爵士，是第一个获此殊荣的音乐评论家。
sentences.en: He was knighted in1967, the first music critic to be so honored.

sentences.cn: 现在，他的书只有一本尚在出版。除了专业人士，没有人知道他过去还撰写过大量的音乐评论。
sentences.en: Yet only one of his books is now in print, and his vast body of writings on music is unknown save to specialists.

sentences.cn: 此外，业余音乐评论的传统也已经在迅速衰退。
sentences.en: Moreover, the amateur tradition in music criticism has been in headlong retreat.

sentences.cn: 对于一直都是由像古斯塔夫·马勒和皮埃尔·布列兹这样的音乐家来指挥的乐团而言，这样描述乐团的下一任指挥，至少对《纽约时代》的一些读者来说，似乎是一种牵强的赞美。
sentences.en: As a description of the next music director of an orchestra that has hitherto been led by musicians like Gustav Mahler and Pierre Boulez, that seems likely to have struck at least some Times readers as faint praise.

sentences.cn: 当然，他能指挥乐团演奏许多有趣的乐章，然而，我也不是非得去艾弗里·费雪音乐厅或者其他音乐厅听一场有趣的交响乐。
sentences.en: To be sure, he performs an impressive variety of interesting compositions, but it is not necessary for me to visit Avery Fisher Hall, or anywhere else, to hear interesting orchestral music.

sentences.cn: 我所要做的仅仅是走到我的唱片架旁，或者打开电脑，从iTunes下载更多的音乐录音。
sentences.en: All I have to do is to go to my CD shelf, or boot up my computer and download still more recorded music from iTunes.

sentences.cn: 对于古典音乐演奏者而言，他们可能做的回应就是去演奏还没录制成唱片的、有吸引力的新音乐。
sentences.en: One possible response is for classical performers to program attractive new music that is not yet available on record.

sentences.cn: 人类却很独特，他们不仅有能力创造工具，而且能反过来运运用这些工具创建出额外的物质产品一一绘画、雕塑和建筑一一以及其他的精神体验一一音乐、文学、宗教和哲学。
sentences.en: Humans are unique in their capacity to not only make tools but then turn around and use them to create superfluous material goodspaintings, sculpture and architecture—and superfluous experiences—music, literature, religion and philosophy.

sentences.cn: 现在的青少年崇拜他们的父母，而且很希望在职业选择等重大问题上得到父母的指导——当然在音乐、时尚风格等有关个人品位的问题上，他们并不希望父母提什么建议。
sentences.en: Today’s teenagers admire their parents and welcome parental guidance about important matters such as career choice—though certainly not Mom and Dad’s advice on matters of personal taste, such as music or fashion.
sentences.from: 16年6月六级真题（第一套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 在那些年薪超过75,000 美元的家庭中，84% 说他们的孩子们在过去的一年中参加过有组织的体育活动，64% 参与过志愿活动，62% 曾经上过音乐课、舞蹈课或者美术课。
sentences.en: Of families earning more than $75,000 a year, 84% say their children have participated in organized sports over the past year, 64% have done volunteer work and 62% have taken lessons in music, dance or art.
sentences.from: 17年6月六级真题（第二套）| 阅读

sentences.cn: 女：最难唱的音乐是什么？。
sentences.en: W: What’s the most difficult kind of music to sing?.

sentences.cn: 一旦开始表演，你就成为其中的一部分，只不过是用音乐而不是对话来表演。
sentences.en: Once you get out of there, you become that part, only you’re using music instead of dialogue.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 我是这种人，如果我的个人生活遇到问题，我去工作，然后音乐就会让我忘掉烦恼。
sentences.en: I am the kind of person that  if my personal life is hurting, I can go to work and the music will take over.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 在那几个小时里，我会沉浸在音乐里。
sentences.en: For those few hours, I can wrap myself up in my music.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第一套）| 听力

sentences.cn: 男：音乐，我并不是特别喜欢在路上的生活，但是如果你有幸能够做你真正热爱的事情，你就实现了人生的终极意义。
sentences.en: M: Music, I don’t especially love life on the road, but I figure if you are lucky enough to be able to do what you truly love doing, you’ve got the ultimate of life.
sentences.from: 15年12月六级真题（第二套）| 听力

sentences.en: Milton almost requires a solemn service of music to be played before you enter upon him.

sentences.cn: 斯特拉文斯基的乐曲风格是不断变化的.
sentences.en: Stravinsky's music was always changing.

sentences.cn: 他被要求重新演奏这支乐曲.
sentences.en: He is asked to play over the music.

sentences.cn: 这时又奏起了乐曲,我们又接着跳舞.
sentences.en: Then, the music started again and we danced.

sentences.cn: 许多人喜欢他的乐曲.
sentences.en: Many people like his music.

sentences.cn: 要把这支乐曲演奏成音乐,不要听起来像你和乐器间的搏斗.
sentences.en: Play the piece as music and not as a struggle between yourself and your instrument.

sentences.cn: 这首乐曲是用凤凰琴弹奏出来的.
sentences.en: This piece of music is played with an ancient musical instrument.

sentences.cn: 作品中的女孩就深深地沉醉于自己所演奏的乐曲之中.
sentences.en: In this sculpture, the girl is deeply intoxicated with the music she is playing.

sentences.cn: 这首乐曲大量运用了电声配乐.
sentences.en: This song used much electronic music.

sentences.cn: 莫扎特创作了许多乐曲.
sentences.en: Mozart composed a lot of music.

sentences.cn: 乐曲声使他兴奋起来.
sentences.en: He was hopped up by the music.

sentences.cn: 他曾毁掉很多他写的乐曲,因为他对这些乐曲不满意.
sentences.en: He destroyed much of the music he had written because he was not satisfied with it.

sentences.cn: 乐曲的音量减弱了,专题新闻广播开始了.
sentences.en: The music faded down and a special news broadcast began.

sentences.cn: 钢琴家在一架大钢琴上弹了几首乐曲.
sentences.en: The pianist played several pieces of music on a grand piano.

sentences.cn: 他不识谱,但却能在钢琴上胡乱弹出乐曲.
sentences.en: He cannot read music but he can knock out a tune on the piano.

sentences.cn: 他演奏的乐曲泠然优美,使人陶醉.
sentences.en: The music he is playing is clear , and beautiful that people become intoxicated with it.

sentences.cn: 这首钢琴乐曲已经被改编成小提琴曲.
sentences.en: The piano music has been transcribed for the violin.

sentences.cn: 这段乐曲的乐章不怎么连贯.
sentences.en: The movements of this piece of music somehow don't fit together.

sentences.cn: 我只得不看乐谱演奏了。
sentences.en: I had to play it without the music.

sentences.cn: 乐谱仍摊开在钢琴上。
sentences.en: The music was still open on the piano (= the paper or book with the musical notes on it) .

sentences.cn: 像动人的五线乐谱, 却透着宁静之美,如诗如画.
sentences.en: Like touching a five line music, but it reveals a tranquil beauty of the picturesque.

sentences.cn: 他连乐谱都不识.
sentences.en: He could not even read music.

sentences.cn: 她把乐谱放在钢琴上,坐了下来.
sentences.en: She placed the music on the piano and sat down.

sentences.cn: 弦诗乐是用弹拨乐器演奏乐谱的总称.
sentences.en: Tone poems are a general name for poems set to music and played on plucked instruments.

sentences.cn: 在那位朋友的家中,却有一个乐谱的新天地.
sentences.en: There in the friend's house was a new world of music.

sentences.cn: 他一张张地翻乐谱.
sentences.en: He leafed through the music.

sentences.cn: 她能不看乐谱,光凭听觉记忆弹奏最难的钢琴曲.
sentences.en: She can play the most difficult piano music by ear.

sentences.cn: 这家书店已决定开办售乐谱和唱片的业务.
sentences.en: The book shop has decided to branch out into selling music and records.

sentences.cn: 弹钢琴的人把乐谱忘了,只好即兴伴奏.
sentences.en: The pianist forgot his music and had to improvise.

sentences.cn: 日报河口钻柯林斯trumpet. frenchhornThis乐谱有铅笔书写, 松散页, 一般磨损.
sentences.en: Daily Embouchure Drills COLLINS trumpet. french sheet music has pencil writing, loose page, and general wear.

sentences.cn: 任何伟大的音乐家都不会将一首交响曲和一张印刷的乐谱相混淆.
sentences.en: No great musician confuses a symphony with the print ed sheet of music.

sentences.cn: 把你对乐曲所作的修改在乐谱上记下来.
sentences.en: Mark in the changes you have made to the music.

sentences.cn: 我把乐谱落在家里了.
sentences.en: I'd left my music at home.

sentences.cn: 在这幅作品中,那些音乐家看上去与其说像真实的人,不若说更像乐谱上的音符.
sentences.en: Here the musicians look more like notes on a sheet of music than like real people.

sentences.cn: 一个好的演奏者一看到乐谱就能演奏出来.
sentences.en: A good player can read music at sight.

sentences.cn: 书店已决定扩大营业范围,开辟出售乐谱和唱片的业务.
sentences.en: The bookshop has decided to branch out into selling music and records.

sentences.cn: 她很骄傲地不用乐谱就弹得出古典曲子.
sentences.en: With proudness she plays classic piano parts without music paper.

sentences.cn: 他把乐谱放回到乐谱架上.
sentences.en: He restored the music to the music stand.

sentences.cn: 把乐谱架折叠起来.
sentences.en: Collapse the music stand.

sentences.cn: 她挥动起指挥棒; 敲击了乐谱架两下.
sentences.en: She raised the baton ; she tapped the music stand twice.

sentences.cn: 你学弹吉他时看乐谱还是不看乐谱?
sentences.en: Did you learn to play the guitar by ear or by reading music?

sentences.cn: 这些命令用看不见的墨迹写在她的乐谱上.
sentences.en: The orders were written in disappearing ink on pages of her music.

sentences.cn: 音乐家能看懂乐谱.
sentences.en: Musicians can read written music.

sentences.cn: 八分音符 、 四分音符和二分音符在乐谱上是不同长度的三个音符.
sentences.en: Quavers, crotchets and minims are three of the different lengths of note in written music.

sentences.cn: 古典音乐通常是由专业的艺术家来演奏, 他们是严格按照乐谱来演奏音乐的.
sentences.en: Classical music is usually performed by professional artists, who played the music exactly as written.

sentences.cn: 弹钢琴的人把乐谱忘了,只好即兴伴奏.
sentences.en: The pianist forgot his music and had to improvise ( the accompaniment ).

sentences.cn: 我能不看乐谱弹奏钢琴, 不过现在我后悔没有真正学会识乐谱.
sentences.en: I can play the piano by ear, but I regret now that I never learned to read music properly.

sentences.cn: 一个瓮声瓮气的嗓音宣布拜堂开始, 乐队开始吹打.
sentences.en: A deep voice announced the commencement of the wedding rites, and the music began.

sentences.cn: 还有专为乐器谱写的乐曲,它可以由某种乐器单独演奏, 也可以由一个管弦乐队一起演奏.
sentences.en: Music was also written for instruments played alone, or together in an ORCHESTRA.

sentences.cn: 管弦乐队通常演奏古典音乐.
sentences.en: An orchestra usually plays classical music.

sentences.cn: 几年过去, 这支新的乐队引起了广泛的关注.
sentences.en: Several years passed, and the new music band got a lot of attention.

sentences.cn: 这些巡游包括宴会和随着乐队的音乐跳舞.
sentences.en: These cruises include dinner and dancing to music performed by a band.

sentences.cn: 这个乐队有四名音乐师, 两名男的,两名女的.
sentences.en: This music group has four musicians, two men and two women.

sentences.cn: 代表着香港音乐辉煌的温拿乐队再次回来了!
sentences.en: Represent the glorious music of the temperature in Hong Kong take band back again!

sentences.cn: 一朵朵喇叭花在一起生长着, 仿佛一支乐队在吹奏一曲美妙的音乐.
sentences.en: Together with the growth a blossoming morning glory, as if a band playing a wonderful music.

sentences.cn: 她的爱好是在乐队演奏音乐和听音乐.
sentences.en: Her hobby is playing music in a band, as well as listening to music.

sentences.cn: 音乐是由坐在台前管弦乐队演奏的.
sentences.en: The music was played the orchestra seated in front the stage.

sentences.cn: 甲壳虫乐队是一种新音乐风格的先驱.
